author: Daniel Kruger
title: U.S. Government Bonds Gain as Inflation Expectations Weaken
text:
U.S. government bonds advanced Thursday as investors focused on signs of slowing growth amid mixed economic data.
The yield on the benchmark 10-year Treasury note fell for a third consecutive session to 2.741%—its lowest close since the end of January—from 2.777% Wednesday. Yields fall as bond prices rise. It was the largest three-day decline in yields since May. The benchmark yield rose 0.332 percentage point during the quarter after falling 0.129 percentage point in March.
